intro: Cineraria abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
